contents.sentence: At locations where the inertial profiler is being used on a surface course, were all areas under category Type A, as defined in

, having a localized roughness in excess of 160 in./mi or category Type B in excess of 170 in./mi utilizing continuous IRI with a 25 ft window corrected subject to approval by the Engineer? After ALRs have been identified, a grinding simulation shall be performed to estimate whether the ALR can be corrected to an IRI value of less than 160 in./mi with no more than a 1/4 in. max grind depth at any spot. If such correction is not possible, then an ALR with an IRI value of less than 190 in./mi can remain uncorrected if approved by the Engineer, and an ALR with an IRI value greater than 190 in./mi shall require full depth removal and replacement of the surface course of sufficient area to meet specifications.
To ensure localized roughness areas meet smoothness standards and prevent potential ride quality issues.
At locations where the inertial profiler is being used on a surface course, confirm that all areas under conditions 1 or 2 are corrected subject to approval by the Engineer.
• Condition 1: Category Type A & having a localized roughness in excess of 160 in./mi utilizing continuous IRI with a 25 ft window
• Condition 2: Category Type B & having a localized roughness in excess of 170 in./mi utilizing continuous IRI with a 25 ft window

If the ALR cannot be corrected to an IRI value of less than 160 in./mi with no more than ¼ in. max grind depth at any spot, then an ALR with an IRI value of less than 190 in./mi can remain uncorrected if approved by the Engineer. An ALR with an IRI value greater than 190 in./mi shall require full-depth removal and replacement of the surface course of sufficient area to meet specifications.

:
Pavement on a non-interstate with more than a single opportunity to achieve a smooth ride or asphalt pavement on an interstate with a single opportunity or more. The following operations will be considered opportunities:
a. A layer of HMA base, intermediate, and surface; each layer is an opportunity. Wedge and level will not be considered an opportunity.
b. Profile milling to correct cross slope is considered an opportunity prior to placing base, intermediate, or surface HMA.

:
Pavement that is not included in the description above under Type A.
